item.description:
Hello, and Happy Spring to all!

May's meet-up will be similar to the conversational format that we've had in the past with one exception: we're going to talk a little bit about one of Ayn Rand's early works, "Good Copy," which you can find in "The Early Ayn Rand." I believe this can be ordered through Amazon.com or Barnes & Noble without much difficulty. If you cannot find it, let me know.

"Good Copy" is a humorous, short piece of non-fiction from - as the title states - Ayn Rand's early years. A new member of our group suggested that we read something for the next get-together so that all of us, whether new to Ayn Rand or "veterans," would have some common ground for discussion. The thought at this meeting was to begin alternating weeks of fiction with non-fiction.

Secondly, someone suggested that with our group growing like it is (tables of 9 are getting a little crowded at Starbucks) we might want to consider changing the venue. Apparently, (and I will investigate this) the Beantown Pub would be willing to let us gather there, as long as we "consume" something. I will find out what the parameters are.

In the meantime, please email or post your comments on your suggestions for a venue for May. We can always do Starbucks again, but in anticipation of the throngs of people that this group is attracting :-) I would like to have ample space.

Feel free to come with as little or as much knowledge of Ayn Rand as you have.

I have to pay meetup.com $19.00 per month to use their site, but for me, this is a small price to pay for the opportunity to meet other people interested in Objectivism, the philosophy of Ayn Rand. However, if anyone would be willing to donate a dollar or two to help me defray the monthly expenditure, that would be great.

group.name: The Boston Ayn Rand Meetup Group

item.name: The Boston Ayn Rand May Meetup
